page.title: 13THE VILLAGE CENTRE,OXSHOTT
page.content: A little church was built in 1913 and in the 1950's a Village Centre was built on to the west end of the church. There is a children's activity centre inside, a creche, playgroup and also a little theatre and canteen, so it is a busy centre. Many local people take part in events. The{church}itself isn't very big, just a small place, very pretty, and quite modern. Of course family services and holy communions are all included. The vicar helps out with the area and takes all services. One big event of the year is the Christmas fair in the Village Centre in aid of nominated charities when everyone takes part. Other activities include: child health centre, doctor's surgery, political party meetings, county library and a mothers' union.
